titleStmt.title: W. P. Anderson to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12512

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.collection: Union Artillery, Navy and Marines Primary Source Documents ; Misc U.S.C.T. Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 14, Folder BTRY C - 1st REGT LIGHT ARTILLERY 3nd BTRY OFFICERS

body.p:
Head-Quarters Department of the Ohio,
Cincinnati, Ohio, November 11th 1863.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 423,

3 ,, ,, ,, 1st Sergeant Hugh S. Rawls. Battery "C" 1st Artillery Kentucky Volunteers, is discharged the service, to date from the sixth day of November 1863, to enable him to accept a Commission then tendered him by the Governor of Kentucky and since when he has been acting in the capacity of a Commissioned Officer.

By Order of Major General Burnside.
W. P. Anderson
Assistant Adjutant General.
